column2: hese next questions are about liquids, sprays, and gases that people sniff or inhale to get high or to make them feel good.
e are not interested in times when you inhaled a substance accidentally — such as when painting, cleaning an oven, or filling a car with gasoline.
The questions use the word ‘inhalant’ to include all the things listed below, as well as any other substances that people sniff or inhale for kicks or to
get high.  Take a moment to look at the substances listed below so you know what kinds of liquids, sprays, and gases these questions are about.

column1: Amyl nitrite, 'poppers,' locker room odorizers, or 'rush'
Correction fluid, degreaser, or cleaning fluid
Lacquer thinner, or other paint solvents
Lighter gases, such as butane or propane
Felt-tip pens, felt-tip markers, or magic markers
Computer keyboard cleaner, also known as air duster
